trans-unit.source: Import data into Machine Learning Studio | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Import data into Machine Learning Studio | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: How to import your data into Azure Machine Learning Studio from various data sources.
trans-unit.target: How to import your data into Azure Machine Learning Studio from various data sources.

trans-unit.source: Learn what data types and data formats are supported.
trans-unit.target: Learn what data types and data formats are supported.

trans-unit.source: Import your training data into Azure Machine Learning Studio from various data sources
trans-unit.target: Import your training data into Azure Machine Learning Studio from various data sources

trans-unit.source: Introduction
trans-unit.target: Introduction

trans-unit.source: To use your own data in Machine Learning Studio to develop and train a predictive analytics solution, you can:
trans-unit.target: To use your own data in Machine Learning Studio to develop and train a predictive analytics solution, you can:

trans-unit.source: upload data from a **local file** ahead of time from your hard drive to create a dataset module in your workspace.
trans-unit.target: upload data from a **local file** ahead of time from your hard drive to create a dataset module in your workspace.

trans-unit.source: access data from one of several **online data sources** while your experiment is running using the [Reader][reader] module.
trans-unit.target: access data from one of several **online data sources** while your experiment is running using the [Reader][reader] module.

trans-unit.source: use data from another Azure Machine learning experiment saved as a **dataset**.
trans-unit.target: use data from another Azure Machine learning experiment saved as a **dataset**.

trans-unit.source: Each of these options are described in one of the topics on the menu above.
trans-unit.target: Each of these options are described in one of the topics on the menu above.

trans-unit.source: These topic shows you how to import data from these various data sources to use in Machine Learning Studio.
trans-unit.target: These topic shows you how to import data from these various data sources to use in Machine Learning Studio.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] There are a number of sample datasets available in Machine Learning Studio that you can use for this purpose.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] There are a number of sample datasets available in Machine Learning Studio that you can use for this purpose.

trans-unit.source: For information on these, see [Use the sample datasets in Azure Machine Learning Studio](machine-learning-use-sample-datasets.md)).
trans-unit.target: For information on these, see [Use the sample datasets in Azure Machine Learning Studio](machine-learning-use-sample-datasets.md)).

trans-unit.source: This introductory topic also shows how to get data ready for use in Machine Learning Studio and describes which data formats and data types are supported.
trans-unit.target: This introductory topic also shows how to get data ready for use in Machine Learning Studio and describes which data formats and data types are supported.

trans-unit.source: Get data ready for use in Azure Machine Learning Studio
trans-unit.target: Get data ready for use in Azure Machine Learning Studio

trans-unit.source: Machine Learning Studio is designed to work with rectangular or tabular data, such as text data that's delimited or structured data from a database, though in some circumstances non-rectangular data may be used.
trans-unit.target: Machine Learning Studio is designed to work with rectangular or tabular data, such as text data that's delimited or structured data from a database, though in some circumstances non-rectangular data may be used.

trans-unit.source: It is best if your data is relatively clean.
trans-unit.target: It is best if your data is relatively clean.

trans-unit.source: That is, you'll want to take care of issues such as unquoted strings before you upload the data into your experiment.
trans-unit.target: That is, you'll want to take care of issues such as unquoted strings before you upload the data into your experiment.

trans-unit.source: However, there are modules available in Machine Learning Studio that enable some manipulation of data within your experiment.
trans-unit.target: However, there are modules available in Machine Learning Studio that enable some manipulation of data within your experiment.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the machine learning algorithms you'll be using, you may need to decide how you'll handle data structural issues such as missing values and sparse data, and there are modules that can help with that.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the machine learning algorithms you'll be using, you may need to decide how you'll handle data structural issues such as missing values and sparse data, and there are modules that can help with that.

trans-unit.source: Look in the **Data Transformation** section of the module palette for modules that perform these functions.
trans-unit.target: Look in the **Data Transformation** section of the module palette for modules that perform these functions.

trans-unit.source: At any point in your experiment you can view or download the data that's produced by a module by right-clicking the output port.
trans-unit.target: At any point in your experiment you can view or download the data that's produced by a module by right-clicking the output port.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the module there may be different download options available, or you may be able to view the data within your web browser in Machine Learning Studio.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the module there may be different download options available, or you may be able to view the data within your web browser in Machine Learning Studio.

trans-unit.source: Data formats and data types supported
trans-unit.target: Data formats and data types supported

trans-unit.source: You can import a number of data types into your experiment, depending on what mechanism you use to import data and where it's coming from:
trans-unit.target: You can import a number of data types into your experiment, depending on what mechanism you use to import data and where it's coming from:

trans-unit.source: Plain text (.txt)
trans-unit.target: Plain text (.txt)

trans-unit.source: Comma-separated values (CSV) with a header (.csv) or without (.nh.csv)
trans-unit.target: Comma-separated values (CSV) with a header (.csv) or without (.nh.csv)

trans-unit.source: Tab-separated values (TSV) with a header (.tsv) or without (.nh.tsv)
trans-unit.target: Tab-separated values (TSV) with a header (.tsv) or without (.nh.tsv)

trans-unit.source: Hive table
trans-unit.target: Hive table

trans-unit.source: SQL database table
trans-unit.target: SQL database table

trans-unit.source: OData values
trans-unit.target: OData values

trans-unit.source: SVMLight data (.svmlight) (see the [SVMLight definition](http://svmlight.joachims.org/) for format information)
trans-unit.target: SVMLight data (.svmlight) (see the [SVMLight definition](http://svmlight.joachims.org/) for format information)

trans-unit.source: Attribute Relation File Format (ARFF) data (.arff) (see the [ARFF definition](http://weka.wikispaces.com/ARFF) for format information)
trans-unit.target: Attribute Relation File Format (ARFF) data (.arff) (see the [ARFF definition](http://weka.wikispaces.com/ARFF) for format information)

trans-unit.source: Zip file (.zip)
trans-unit.target: Zip file (.zip)

trans-unit.source: R object or workspace file (.RData)
trans-unit.target: R object or workspace file (.RData)

trans-unit.source: If you import data in a format such as ARFF that includes metadata, Machine Learning Studio uses this metadata to define the heading and data type of each column.
trans-unit.target: If you import data in a format such as ARFF that includes metadata, Machine Learning Studio uses this metadata to define the heading and data type of each column.

trans-unit.source: If you import data such as TSV or CSV format that doesn't include this metadata, Machine Learning Studio infers the data type for each column by sampling the data.
trans-unit.target: If you import data such as TSV or CSV format that doesn't include this metadata, Machine Learning Studio infers the data type for each column by sampling the data.

trans-unit.source: If the data also doesn't have column headings, Machine Learning Studio provides default names.
trans-unit.target: If the data also doesn't have column headings, Machine Learning Studio provides default names.

trans-unit.source: You can explicitly specify or change the headings and data types for columns using the [Metadata Editor][metadata-editor].
trans-unit.target: You can explicitly specify or change the headings and data types for columns using the [Metadata Editor][metadata-editor].

trans-unit.source: The following **data types** are recognized by Machine Learning Studio:
trans-unit.target: The following **data types** are recognized by Machine Learning Studio:

trans-unit.source: String
trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: Integer
trans-unit.target: Integer

trans-unit.source: Double
trans-unit.target: Double

trans-unit.source: Boolean
trans-unit.target: Boolean

trans-unit.source: DateTime
trans-unit.target: DateTime

trans-unit.source: TimeSpan
trans-unit.target: TimeSpan

trans-unit.source: Machine Learning Studio uses an internal data type called ***Data Table*** to pass data between modules.
trans-unit.target: Machine Learning Studio uses an internal data type called ***Data Table*** to pass data between modules.

trans-unit.source: You can explicitly convert your data into Data Table format using the [Convert to Dataset][convert-to-dataset] module.
trans-unit.target: You can explicitly convert your data into Data Table format using the [Convert to Dataset][convert-to-dataset] module.

trans-unit.source: Any module that accepts formats other than Data Table will convert the data to Data Table silently before passing it to the next module.
trans-unit.target: Any module that accepts formats other than Data Table will convert the data to Data Table silently before passing it to the next module.

trans-unit.source: If necessary, you can convert Data Table format back into CSV, TSV, ARFF, or SVMLight format using other conversion modules.
trans-unit.target: If necessary, you can convert Data Table format back into CSV, TSV, ARFF, or SVMLight format using other conversion modules.

trans-unit.source: Look in the **Data Format Conversions** section of the module palette for modules that perform these functions.
trans-unit.target: Look in the **Data Format Conversions** section of the module palette for modules that perform these functions.

trans-unit.source: [convert-to-dataset]: https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/72bf58e0-fc87-4bb1-9704-f1805003b975/ [metadata-editor]: https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/370b6676-c11c-486f-bf73-35349f842a66/ [reader]: https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/4e1b0fe6-aded-4b3f-a36f-39b8862b9004/
trans-unit.target: [convert-to-dataset]: https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/72bf58e0-fc87-4bb1-9704-f1805003b975/ [metadata-editor]: https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/370b6676-c11c-486f-bf73-35349f842a66/ [reader]: https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/4e1b0fe6-aded-4b3f-a36f-39b8862b9004/
